name: Word problems involving addition and subtraction of fractions with a common denominator

skills.name: Add proper fractions with the same denominator
Add fractions involving mixed number fractions with the same denominator
Add fractions involving improper fractions with the same denominator
Subtract proper fractions with the same denominator
Subtract fractions involving mixed number fractions with the same denominator

explanations.A: I think you have subtracted the fractions but we need to add them as she eats 3/16 and then another 2/16...
explanations.B: You have accidentally added the denominators! When adding fractions with the same denominator, you only add the numerators...
explanations.C: If Petra eats 3/16 of a pizza and then another 2/16 she has eaten 3/16 + 2/16 in total which is 5/16
explanations.D: I think you have accidentally multiplied the numerators but you need to add them...

explanations.A: You have accidentally added the denominators! When adding fractions with the same denominator, you only add the numerators...
explanations.B: I think you have accidentally multiplied the numerators but you need to add them...
explanations.C: I think you have subtracted the fractions but we need to add them as she eats 3/20 and then another 4/20...
explanations.D: If Amy eats 3/20 of a pizza and then another 4/20 she has eaten 3/20 + 4/20 in total which is 7/20

explanations.A: I think you have added the fractions but you need to subtract them because he is taking the flour out of the cup...
explanations.B: If we have 5 of something and then we take out 2, we're left with 3 of it so 5/8 - 2/8 = 3/8
explanations.C: You have accidentally subtracted the denominators! When subtracting fractions with the same denominator, you only subtract the numerators...
explanations.D: I think you have added the fractions but we need to subtract them. When subtracting fractions with the same denominator, you just subtract the numerators...

explanations.A: If we have 5 of something and then we take out 3, we're left with 2 of it so 5/12 - 3/12 = 2/12
explanations.B: I think you have added the fractions but you need to subtract them because he is taking the flour out of the cup...
explanations.C: I think you have added the fractions but we need to subtract them. When subtracting fractions with the same denominator, you just subtract the numerators...
explanations.D: You have accidentally subtracted the denominators! When subtracting fractions with the same denominator, you only subtract the numerators...

explanations.A: Because we are putting the contents of the three pans together, we need to add them: 11/4 + 7/4 + 3/4 = 21/4
explanations.B: You have accidentally added the denominators! When adding fractions with the same denominator, you only add the numerators...
explanations.C: You have subtracted the numerators but we need to add them because we are putting the contents of the three pans together...
explanations.D: You just need to add together 11/4, 7/4 and 3/4. You have accidentally calculated the contents if there were 3 pans of each size so 9 pans in total!

explanations.A: You have accidentally added the denominators! When adding fractions with the same denominator, you only add the numerators...
explanations.B: You just need to add together 24/5, 13/5 and 4/5. You have accidentally calculated the contents if there were 3 pans of each size so 9 pans in total!
explanations.C: Because we are putting the contents of the three pans together, we need to add them: 24/5 + 13/5 + 4/5 = 41/5
explanations.D: You have subtracted the numerators but we need to add them because we are putting the contents of the three pans together...

explanations.A: You have correctly done 4 - 1 = 3 but then you need to do 5/12 - 7/12 and take this value away from 3 because the sum is 4 5/12 - 1 7/12...
explanations.B: You have added the fractions but we need to do 4 5/12 subtract 1 7/12 because we are cutting off the 1 7/12 piece from the 4 5/12 piece...
explanations.C: You have added the fractions but we need to do 4 5/12 subtract 1 7/12 because we are cutting off the 1 7/12 piece from the 4 5/12 piece...
explanations.D: To find out how much wood Akila has remaining we need to do 4 5/12 subtract the piece she cuts off which is 1 7/12. 4 - 1 = 3 and 5/12 - 7/12 = -2/12 so finally 3 - 2/12 = 2 10/12

explanations.A: You have added the fractions but we need to do 6 3/8 subtract 2 5/8 because we are cutting off the 2 5/8 piece from the 6 3/8 piece...
explanations.B: To find out how much ribbon Laura has remaining we need to do 6 3/8 subtract the piece she cuts off which is 2 5/8. 6 - 2 = 4 and 3/8 - 5/8 = -2/8 so finally 4 - 2/8 = 3 6/8
explanations.C: You have correctly done 6 - 4 = 2 but then you need to do 3/8 - 5/8 and take this value away from 2 because the difference is 6 3/8 - 2 5/8...
explanations.D: You have added the fractions but we need to do 6 3/8 subtract 2 5/8 because we are cutting off the 2 5/8 piece from the 6 3/8 piece...

explanations.A: You have accidentally added the denominators! When adding fractions with the same denominator, you only add the numerators...
explanations.B: To find the total we need to do 2 1/4 + 3/4 + 1 1/4 so we add the whole numbers 2 + 1 = 3 and then the fractions 1/4 + 3/4 + 1/4 = 1 1/4 so altogether we have 4 and 1/4
explanations.C: 2 1/4 means 2 + 1/4 not 2 x 1/4. To find the total you need to do: 2 + 1/4 + 3/4 + 1 + 1/4...
explanations.D: You have subtracted the values but we need to add them to find the total butter needed...

explanations.A: You have subtracted the values but we need to add them to find the total butter needed...
explanations.B: 2 1/3 means 2 + 1/3 not 2 x 1/3. To find the total you need to do: 2 + 1/3 + + 2/3 + 1 + 2/3...
explanations.C: You have accidentally added the denominators! When adding fractions with the same denominator, you only add the numerators...
explanations.D: To find the total we need to do 2/3 + 2 1/3 + 1 2/3 so we add the whole numbers 2 + 1 = 3 and then the fractions 2/3 + 1/3 + 2/3 = 1 2/3 so altogether we have 4 and 2/3
